heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

nearest_lightning.status: The closest strike happened on 13 May 2025, a distance of just 4.97 miles away.

storm.status: An active storm has been detected in the vicinity.  The last storm experienced was on 15 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: It is currently one of the longest rainy periods.  It is the ranked 5th since our records started in 23 September 2024.  There have been 9 consecutive days where it has been rainy starting on 09 September 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (202°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 1.8°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 8%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 631 m) and light levels (up 3994 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1115 m) and light levels (up 5222 lux) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 630.5m lower than yesterday, 558.9m lower than the past week, 1115.4m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 850m and a peak of 2900m, averaging 916.2m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
cloud levels.summary: The sky may alternate between sunny and overcast.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, extremely heavy humidity levels and little or no wind. Drizzle or light rain possible, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and periods of sunshine are expected. No significant shifts in the weather are expected.
